trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Radioactive Soles
entries: The Radioactive Tarrasque gains 120 feet flying speed at its turn's start. When flying, its takeoff ignites a 30ft radius in radioactive flames, causing {@damage 15d4} fire damage and {@damage 10d4} poison damage to creatures failing a {@dc 20} Dexterity save. Its landing mimics a meteor slam within a 30ft radius, dealing {@damage 15d6} bludgeoning damage to creatures failing the same save, as it impacts the ground with force.

trait.name: Aura of Radioactivity
entries: 300 ft. from the Tarrasque.
{@b Radiant Burst}: At the Tarrasque's turn start, creatures within the aura must make a {@dc 20} Constitution save. On a fail, they take {@damage 10d6} radiant damage, or half on success.
{@b Necrotic Decay}: At the start of a creature's turn within the aura, they must make a {@dc 20} Constitution save. On a fail, they take {@damage 10d6} necrotic damage, or half on success.
{@b Radiation Sickness}: Failing any save by 5 or more causes one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
{@b Cumulative Exposure}: Each consecutive round within the aura increases save DCs by 1, resetting after 24 hours outside

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its radioactive Spear Generator. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the tarrasque's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The tarrasque makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) acid damage and  56 ({@damage 16d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of the tarrasque's turns.

If the tarrasque takes 80 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Radioactive Spear Generator
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 200 ft., one target. {@h}42 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. If the attack roll exceeds the target's AC by 5 or more, the target suffers Radiation Poisoning, gaining disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the Radiation Poisoning on a successful save. The spear forms from where the tail would have been, but it's been mechanically modified to produce large spears of radioactive crystal.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The tarrasque makes one claw attack or Radioactive spear attack

legendary.name: Move
entries: The tarrasque moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tarrasque makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

The legendary tarrasque is possibly the most dreaded monster of the Material Plane. It is widely believed that only one of these creatures exists, though no one can predict where and when it will strike.

A scaly biped, the tarrasque is fifty feet tall and seventy feet long, weighing hundreds of tons. It carries itself like a bird of prey, leaning forward and using its powerful lashing tail for balance. Its cavernous maw yawns wide enough to swallow all but the largest creatures, and so great is its hunger that it can devour the populations of whole towns.

entries.name: Legendary Destruction
entries: The destructive potential of the tarrasque is so vast that some cultures incorporate the monster into religious doctrine, weaving its sporadic appearance into stories of divine judgment and wrath.

Legends tell how the tarrasque slumbers in its secret lair beneath the earth, remaining in a dormant state for decades or centuries. When it awakens in answer to some inscrutable cosmic call, it rises from the depths to obliterate everything in its path.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Astral Form
entries: This tarrasque projects a 30-foot radius portal to the Astral Sea, housing its true form. In the material plane, an immense astral tarrasque is seen ravaging its surroundings. Creatures entering or attempting to exit this 30-foot radius must make a Charisma saving throw ({@dc 22}). On a successful save, they resist being drawn into the Astral Plane or manage to escape back to the material plane. On a failure, they are either transported to the Astral Sea, where they confront the real tarrasque, or prevented from leaving this perilous zone, with their attacks capable of affecting the tarrasque directly.

trait.name: Drowning in the astral sea
entries: Within a 100-foot radius of the tarrasque, dense astral energy inflicts {@damage 8d10} bludgeoning damage to creatures at the start of its turn. {@dc 22} Constitution save required; failure by 5 or more also stuns until the next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the tarrasque's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Planar Swallow
entries: When the tarrasque successfully bites and swallows a Large or smaller creature it is grappling, the target is instantly transported to a random vortex in an elemental plane, bypassing the usual conditions of being swallowed. Upon arrival, the creature suffers 99 ({@damage 22d8}) damage from the vortex's chaotic energy before immediately reappearing outside the tarrasque's planar aura, ending the grapple.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The tarrasque makes one claw attack or tail attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The tarrasque moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tarrasque makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

The legendary tarrasque is possibly the most dreaded monster of the Material Plane. It is widely believed that only one of these creatures exists, though no one can predict where and when it will strike.

A scaly biped, the tarrasque is fifty feet tall and seventy feet long, weighing hundreds of tons. It carries itself like a bird of prey, leaning forward and using its powerful lashing tail for balance. Its cavernous maw yawns wide enough to swallow all but the largest creatures, and so great is its hunger that it can devour the populations of whole towns.

entries.name: Legendary Destruction
entries: The destructive potential of the tarrasque is so vast that some cultures incorporate the monster into religious doctrine, weaving its sporadic appearance into stories of divine judgment and wrath.

Legends tell how the tarrasque slumbers in its secret lair beneath the earth, remaining in a dormant state for decades or centuries. When it awakens in answer to some inscrutable cosmic call, it rises from the depths to obliterate everything in its path.

variantrule.name: Alcohol and other things that will kill you.... Or save you
entries: The multiverse of Infinitum is multifaceted to say the least. However, one thing that does not lose its meaning between the endless worlds of Infinitum is the insatiable curiosity. Naturally, this curiosity becomes the origin for many professions that build on trial and error. Any hopeless mucker can take up, with practice of course, the tools of a chef, a brewer, a poisoner, a herbalist or an alchemist. These people look for meaning in the endless unsense of components. There is always another combination, a way to better an existing combination, a way to transcend the binding functions of these components into something that carries more meaning and create things that are worth more than the sum of their parts.

entries.name: These professions in Infinitum
entries: In your travels around the multiverse, you will find individuals at various skill levels in these professions. The ones that are {@b Proficient}, the ones that are {@b Experts}, the ones that are {@b Masters} and finally, the ones that are {@b True masters}. Everyone starts their journey at the most base of this lengthy adventure in search of the true concoction.

As a player, you can start your journey in any of these four professions at the {@b Proficient} or the {@b Expert} level, provided your class or background gives you proficiency or expertise in these professions.

Alternatively, you can spend your downtime training under a {@b Master} or a {@b True Master} to gain proficiency in these tools. The table below lists the profession, time needed and the cost of training under a master.
Once you are proficient, you can train for expertise. The time needed to train for expertise in a profession is double the initial period.

As an Expert, You can add twice your proficiency bonus to checks made with the tool of your profession. Additionally, you can look for a true master to train further and become a master yourself. The time needed to train for master status in a profession is three times the initial period.

As a master, You can add four times your proficiency bonus to checks you make with the tools of your profession. Additionally, you begin your initial true master training under a true master for four times the initial period. After that, you have to spend double the initial period working out your original style for the profession of your choice. You do not spend gold for these two weeks but you must stay in downtime.

As a True Master, you have reached the pinnacle of your art. You are respected across continents as a True Master of the art. You receive an invite to the Guild of True Craftsmen and you can use your influence to always gain a 50% reduction to
prices on sales under your profession. You also add four times your proficiency bonus to checks you make with the tools of your profession and you treat any d20 roll of 14 or lower on the checks as a 15.

entries.name: Skill checks related to your profession
entries: As a skilled individual in your profession, you get certain bonuses to non-modification checks you make with your tools.

variantrule.name: The Herbalist
entries: As an herbalist, you have learned the uses of certain flora and fauna to make treatments against deadly effects. With proficiency in this tool, you can use downtime to craft any of the healing potions from the table below provided you have the time and gold.

entries.name: Herbal Remedies
entries: As an expert herbalist, you have mastered the finer aspects of the profession. You know the methods to better even the mildest of healing potions. However, you can only better the potions you make yourself since the composition of potions differ between craftsmen.

You can spend gold equal to 160% of the crafting cost to modify your potion. Make an herbalism kit check (Intelligence) with the DC equal to the DC given on the table below. On a Success, you can roll one additional healing dice when you use this healing potion. You so so it by spending 1 hour for every 50gp you spend(Rounded up). The DC for subsequent use of Herbal remedies also goes up by 1 for this dose. On a Failurethe potion is lost and unusable. You can do this to a single dose as many times as your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Optimization
entries: As a Master, whenever a healing potion crafted by you is used, you can roll the hitpoints that the potion restores twice and choose one of the two totals. Additionally, you can use Herbal Remedies on a single dose as many times as twice your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Herbalist Ascendancy
entries: A true master of the craft can make even the most effective healing remedies. If you have the gold, you can make any healing potion at the end of a long rest. This healing potion will be created with the maximum herbal remedies applications. Once you create a healing potion this way, you cannot do so again for 1 week. Additionally, when you roll for healing on a healing potion created by you, you always roll the maximum value.

variantrule.name: The Poisoner
entries: As a poisoner, you have learned the uses of certain flora and fauna to make deadly poisons. With proficiency in this tool, you can use downtime to craft any of the poisons from the poisoner's table below provided you have access to the materials, time, and gold needed for the ones that do.
You will need to spend 1 hour for every 50gp you spend making the poison.

entries.name: Using a poison
entries: Every Vial of contact and injury poison can hold upto 3 doses of a certain poison. Each time you harvest poison from a deador incapacitated creature, you need to succeed on a Poisoner's kit (Intelligence) check of DC 20. On a success, you get one dose of the poison.

As an action, you can coat a melee weapon with the poison or dip upto 3 pieces of ammunition. The Poison loses potency after 3 successful melee attacks. Ammmunition that misses can be collected and used again. In any case, an application will have potency for 1 minute from the application time.

entries.name: Malicious Addition
entries: As an expert poisoner, you have mastered the finer aspects of the profession. You know the methods to better even the mildest of poisons. You can only better the poisons you make yourself since the composition of poisons not made by you is hard to figure out. However, if the poison is a venom, you can attempt to increase its potency anyway.

You can spend gold equal to 160% of the crafting cost to modify your poison. Make a poisoners kit check (Intelligence) with the DC equal to the Saving throw DC of the poison. On a Success, the DC of the poison goes up by 1 and you add one more damage die to it by spending 1 hour for every 50gp you spend(Rounded up).On a Failure, the poison is lost and unusable. You can do this to a single dose as many times as your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Optimization
entries: As a Master, the Saving throw DC for any poison you make/harvest cannot be less than 15. Additionally, you can use Malicious Addition on a single vial as many times as twice your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Poisoner Ascendancy
entries: A true master of the craft can make even the most potent of poisons. As part of the Guild of True Craftsmen, you have access to every poison component that costs less than 1000gp and you can buy them instantly through the bag of holding you receive as a True Master.
Additionally, the Saving throw DC of any poison you make/harvest cannot be less than 19.

variantrule.name: The Alchemist
entries: As an alchemist, you have learned the way of transmuter. You can make reagents and chemicals with devastating effects or restorative properties depending on your mood. With proficiency in this tool, you gain a permanent 20% cost reduction on all costs incurred in the {@variantrule The Herbalist|agidm|Herbalist} and {@variantrule The Poisoner|agidm|Poisoner} professions including the learning costs.
Magic is unnecessary to create alchemical items, but arcane ingredients are required. These items are rare and expensive, so alchemists commonly have adventuring backgrounds.

To make Alchemical Reagents/items, you need to acquire the formula for the reagent. Check the {@table Alchemical formulae|agidm|Alchemical formulae} table for all alchemist formulae available for purchase and the ability needed to make each item

When you get proficency in this tool, you learn two {@table Alchemical formulae|agidm|Alchemical formulae} of your choice from the table. Everytime you gain a level after proficiency, you learn one additional formulae.

entries.name: Making an alchemical reagent
entries: You can use Alchemist's supplies to create the reagents/items you own the formulae to.

When you make an alchemical item, make a check with your Alchemists Supplies with the listed ability. On a success, the item is created successfully. On a failure, the item and the materials are lost. On a Critical success, the item deals double the dice as damage if it has a damage value. You can still roll the skill check as a true master and a failure can be treated as a success. Each Alchemical creation can have upto 6 levels of refinement. Your skill at this profession dictates the maximum level of the item you can create.

entries.name: Expert Transmuter
entries: As an expert in alchemist's supplies, you gain a +10% permanent cost reduction to costs incurred in the Herbalist and Poisoner professions.

Additionally, you can alter permanently properties of objects to gather energy. You perform a special alchemical procedure on one object composed entirely of Stone (but not a gemstone), Wood, iron, copper, silver, or gold. Transforming it into a material of a lower tier. The energy released from this conversion can be transfered into a spellcaster as a level 1 spell slot. You cannot add more spell slots to a spell caster than they can hold. Refer to the table below for the amount of
material needed and the conversion results.
Every conversion takes 15 minutes of work which can also be part of a short rest. You can do as many conversions as your proficiency bonus and you get all uses back after a long rest.

entries.name: Optimization
entries: As a Master, You gain a further +10% cost reduction on on all costs incurred in the Herbalist and Poisoner professions. Additionally, you can transmute materials to gain spell slots twice as many times as your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Alchemist Ascendancy
entries: A true master of alchemy can draw the residual energies that are lost in the form of heat and light from their material conversions. The spell slots gained from conversations can be level 3 or lower.

Additionally, Every dawn, you can draw upto 2000gp worth of raw materials at half price from your bag of holding of true craftsmen. These materials are enchanted to be only used for transmutation and you must send the residual materials back after drawing their energies before you take a long rest. The bag of holding will refund the amount for the materials you return.

entries.caption: Alchemical Silver
rows: On application of this coating, Your weapon or one group of ammunition (30 arrows, 10 crossbow bolts, 20 sling bullets, or 5 shuriken) attacks as a silvered weapon for the next 1 minute.
The weapon or ammunition deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage against creatures that are vulnerable to silvered weapons.
The weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d6} damage against creatures that are vulnerable to silvered weapons.

entries.caption: Alchemist’s Acid
rows: As an action, you can throw this flask at a creature. Make a ranged attack (20/60) or a melee attack with your strength. On a hit, the creature takes {@dice 1d10} Acid damage and takes an additional {@dice 2d6} Acid damage at the end of their turns unless they take an action to remove the acid. The acid washes off after 1 minute.
{@dice 2d10} Acid Damage and {@dice 3d6} Acid damage per round.
{@dice 3d10} Acid Damage and {@dice 4d6} Acid damage per round.
{@dice 4d10} Acid Damage and {@dice 5d6} Acid damage per round.
{@dice 5d10} Acid Damage and {@dice 6d6} Acid damage per round.
{@dice 6d10} Acid Damage and {@dice 7d6} Acid damage per round.

entries.caption: Alchemist’s Fire
rows: As an action, you can throw this flask at a point on the ground within 60ft that you can see. All Creatures within 20ft of the point must make a Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@dice 1d6} fire damage and are set on fire. A creature can use an action to pat off the flames or take {@dice 1d4} fire damage at the end of their turns. The fire goes out in 1 minute. On a success, creatures take half damage and are not on fire.
{@dice 2d6} Fire damage and {@dice 2d4} fire damage per round.
{@dice 3d6} Fire damage and {@dice 3d4} fire damage per round.
{@dice 4d6} Fire damage and {@dice 4d4} fire damage per round.
{@dice 5d6} Fire damage and {@dice 5d4} fire damage per round.
{@dice 6d6} Fire damage and {@dice 6d4} fire damage per round.

entries.caption: Alchemist’s Frost
rows: As an action, you can throw this flask at a creature. Make a ranged attack (20/60) or a melee attack with your strength. On a hit, the creature takes {@dice 1d10} Cold damage and must make a dexterity saving throw or be restrained in ice. The Ice has 20 Hitpoints and an AC of 10. Any damage targeting the creature will also damage the ice. A creature can take an action to make a strength check to break of the restraint. The ice thaws after 1 minute.
{@dice 2d10} Cold damage and the Ice has 30 Hitpoints.
{@dice 3d10} Cold damage and the Ice has 40 Hitpoints.
{@dice 4d10} Cold damage and the Ice has 50 Hitpoints.
{@dice 5d10} Cold damage and the Ice has 60 Hitpoints.
{@dice 6d10} Cold damage and the Ice has 70 Hitpoints.

entries.caption: Antivenom
rows: Applying this on a poisoned creature will render poisons affecting it of DC 15 or lower inert.
Applying this on a poisoned creature will render poisons affecting it of DC 25 or lower inert.
Applying this on a poisoned creature will render poisons affecting it of DC 35 or lower inert.

entries.caption: Beastbane
rows: As an action, you can light this incense and throw it at a point on the ground within 60ft that you can see. Any beasts within 100ft of the area must make a constitution saving throw or use all its movement and Action(If needed) to exit the area. A moderate breeze will dispel the effect till it flows. The Incense burns away after 1 hour.

entries.caption: Blastpatch
rows:
As an action, you can apply a blast patch to a square within 5ft of you. When a creature walks into the space, it must make a Dexterity saving throw or be subjected to the effects of the blast patch. 

{@b Firepatch} - {@dice 1d8} Fire damage and the target cannot use reactions till the start of its next turn. 

{@b Cold Patch} - {@dice 1d8} Cold damage and the target's speed is 0 till the end of its next turn. 

{@b Shock patch} - {@dice 1d8} Force damage and the target is pushed 10ft back. 

A blast Patch can be detected with passive perception equal to or higher than the DC of the patch.

entries.caption: Blinding Bomb
rows: As an action, you can throw this bomb at a creature. Make a ranged attack (20/60) or a melee attack with your strength. On a hit, the creature and every creature within 5ft of it must make a constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of its turns. On a success, the creature is no longer blinded.

entries.caption: Bloodstinger Poison
rows: As part of the attack action, you can apply this poison to your melee weapon and make an attack against a creature. On a hit, the creature must make a constitution saving throw or be subject to another attack as its movements slow down. If this attack hits, it takes an additional {@dice 2d4} poison damage. If you can already make 2 or more attacks on a turn, you deal the poison damage on your second attack and do not get an extra attack from this poison.

entries.caption: Clearsense Powder
rows: When a Blinded or deafened creature inhales this powder, It is cured of those conditions and gain {@dice 1d4} temporary hitpoints.

entries.caption: Dragonfire Tar
rows: As an action, you can throw this bomb at a creature. Make a ranged attack (20/60) or a melee attack with your strength. On a hit, the creature is covered in tar that burns hot with alchemical flame. At the start of its turns, the creature takes {@dice 3d4} fire damage. As an action, it can remove the tar from its body with a successful sleight of hand check against the DC.

entries.caption: Ghoststrike Oil
rows: As part of the attack action, you can apply this poison to your melee weapon and make an attack against an undead creature. On a hit, the creature must make a constitution saving throw or be subject to another attack as its movements slow down. If this attack hits, it loses all its resistances and immunities and has vulnerability to Psychic damage for a minute. The creature can repeat the save at the end of their turns, ending the effect on a success. If you can already make 2 or more attacks on a turn, the effect applies on your second attack and do not get an extra attack from this oil.

entries.caption: Goodnight Tincture
rows: You apply this tincture to a food or drink item within 5ft of you. A creature that consumes that food or drink must succeed on a constitution saving throw after 1 minute or become {@condition unconscious} for one hour or till it is shook awake, takes damage, or is subject to a harmful effect.

entries.caption: Herbal Incense
rows: As a part of a short rest, you can burn this incense. Any creature that is within 20ft of this incense for the entire duration of the short rest regains an additional 10 hitpoints.

entries.caption: Jolt Flask
rows: As an action, you can throw this flask at a creature. Make a ranged attack (20/60) or a melee attack with your strength. On a hit, the creature and creatures within 5ft of it must make a constitution saving throw or be unable to take any actions till the end of its next turn.

entries.caption: Lockbust Chalk
rows: This chalk expands inside a lock once the end is broken off. If you use a lockbust chalk while lockpicking, you can add +2 to the check.

entries.caption: Slow-Step Oil
rows: As an action, you can apply this poison to your melee weapon and make an attack against a creature. On a hit, the creature must make a constitution saving throw or be subject to another attack as its movements slow down. If this attack hits, its movement speed is halved till the end of its next turn. If you can already make 2 or more attacks on a turn, the effect applies on your second attack and do not get an extra attack from this oil.

entries.caption: Tracking Dust
rows: The tracking dust creates an area 20ft diameter filled with shimmering dust. In areas where the dust is spread, Perception checks to track can be made with a +2 to the check.

entries.caption: Clearwater Solution
rows: On adding clearwater solution to a volume of liquid filling a cube 1 square on side (5 feet by 5 feet by 5 feet; approximately 935 gallons), the solution removes any poison or disease present in the liquid after 1 minute.

entries.caption: Salve of Slipperiness
rows: You take 1 minute to apply this slimy salve to your body. For 10 minutes after this application, you make Acrobatics or Athletics checks against grapples at advantage.

entries.caption: Smokestick
rows: As an action, you throw this to a point you can see within 60 feet. The area within 20 ft of that point is lightly obscured. The smoke lasts until the end of your next turn.
